intro: Salsola ryanii, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Salsola ryanii is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to withstand drought and high temperatures.
